intro: Fumaria agraria var. maximilianii, commonly known as the yellow weed or lesser celandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branching stems that often lie close to the ground. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with four petals, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and have a distinctive waxy coating. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
